3261class Monitor(object): 

3262 """ 

3263 Monitor is useful for handling the MONITOR command to the redis server. 

3264 next_command() method returns one command from monitor 

3265 listen() method yields commands from monitor. 

3266 """ 

3267 monitor_re = re.compile(r'\[(\d+) (.*)\] (.*)') 

3268 command_re = re.compile(r'"(.*?)(?<!\\)"') 

3269 

3270 def __init__(self, connection_pool): 

3271 self.connection_pool = connection_pool 

3272 self.connection = self.connection_pool.get_connection('MONITOR') 

3273 

3274 def __enter__(self): 

3275 self.connection.send_command('MONITOR') 

3276 # check that monitor returns 'OK', but don't return it to user 

3277 response = self.connection.read_response() 

3278 if not bool_ok(response): 

3279 raise RedisError('MONITOR failed: %s' % response) 

3280 return self 

3281 

3282 def __exit__(self, *args): 

3283 self.connection.disconnect() 

3284 self.connection_pool.release(self.connection) 

3285 

3286 def next_command(self): 

3287 "Parse the response from a monitor command" 

3288 response = self.connection.read_response() 

3289 if isinstance(response, bytes): 

3290 response = self.connection.encoder.decode(response, force=True) 

3291 command_time, command_data = response.split(' ', 1) 

3292 m = self.monitor_re.match(command_data) 

3293 db_id, client_info, command = m.groups() 

3294 command = ' '.join(self.command_re.findall(command)) 

3295 command = command.replace('\\"', '"').replace('\\\\', '\\') 

3296 

3297 if client_info == 'lua': 

3298 client_address = 'lua' 

3299 client_port = '' 

3300 client_type = 'lua' 

3301 elif client_info.startswith('unix'): 

3302 client_address = 'unix' 

3303 client_port = client_info[5:] 

3304 client_type = 'unix' 

3305 else: 

3306 # use rsplit as ipv6 addresses contain colons 

3307 client_address, client_port = client_info.rsplit(':', 1) 

3308 client_type = 'tcp' 

3309 return { 

3310 'time': float(command_time), 

3311 'db': int(db_id), 

3312 'client_address': client_address, 

3313 'client_port': client_port, 

3314 'client_type': client_type, 

3315 'command': command 

3316 } 

3317 

3318 def listen(self): 

3319 "Listen for commands coming to the server." 

3320 while True: 

3321 yield self.next_command() 

3322 

3323 

3324class PubSub(object): 

3325 """ 

3326 PubSub provides publish, subscribe and listen support to Redis channels. 

3327 

3328 After subscribing to one or more channels, the listen() method will block 

3329 until a message arrives on one of the subscribed channels. That message 

3330 will be returned and it's safe to start listening again. 

3331 """ 

3332 PUBLISH_MESSAGE_TYPES = ('message', 'pmessage') 

3333 UNSUBSCRIBE_MESSAGE_TYPES = ('unsubscribe', 'punsubscribe') 

3334 HEALTH_CHECK_MESSAGE = 'redis-py-health-check' 

3335 

3336 def __init__(self, connection_pool, shard_hint=None, 

3337 ignore_subscribe_messages=False): 

3338 self.connection_pool = connection_pool 

3339 self.shard_hint = shard_hint 

3340 self.ignore_subscribe_messages = ignore_subscribe_messages 

3341 self.connection = None 

3342 # we need to know the encoding options for this connection in order 

3343 # to lookup channel and pattern names for callback handlers. 

3344 self.encoder = self.connection_pool.get_encoder() 

3345 if self.encoder.decode_responses: 

3346 self.health_check_response = ['pong', self.HEALTH_CHECK_MESSAGE] 

3347 else: 

3348 self.health_check_response = [ 

3349 b'pong', 

3350 self.encoder.encode(self.HEALTH_CHECK_MESSAGE) 

3351 ] 

3352 self.reset() 

3353 

3354 def __enter__(self): 

3355 return self 

3356 

3357 def __exit__(self, exc_type, exc_value, traceback): 

3358 self.reset() 

3359 

3360 def __del__(self): 

3361 try: 

3362 # if this object went out of scope prior to shutting down 

3363 # subscriptions, close the connection manually before 

3364 # returning it to the connection pool 

3365 self.reset() 

3366 except Exception: 

3367 pass 

3368 

3369 def reset(self): 

3370 if self.connection: 

3371 self.connection.disconnect() 

3372 self.connection.clear_connect_callbacks() 

3373 self.connection_pool.release(self.connection) 

3374 self.connection = None 

3375 self.channels = {} 

3376 self.pending_unsubscribe_channels = set() 

3377 self.patterns = {} 

3378 self.pending_unsubscribe_patterns = set() 

3379 

3380 def close(self): 

3381 self.reset() 

3382 

3383 def on_connect(self, connection): 

3384 "Re-subscribe to any channels and patterns previously subscribed to" 

3385 # NOTE: for python3, we can't pass bytestrings as keyword arguments 

3386 # so we need to decode channel/pattern names back to unicode strings 

3387 # before passing them to [p]subscribe. 

3388 self.pending_unsubscribe_channels.clear() 

3389 self.pending_unsubscribe_patterns.clear() 

3390 if self.channels: 

3391 channels = {} 

3392 for k, v in iteritems(self.channels): 

3393 channels[self.encoder.decode(k, force=True)] = v 

3394 self.subscribe(**channels) 

3395 if self.patterns: 

3396 patterns = {} 

3397 for k, v in iteritems(self.patterns): 

3398 patterns[self.encoder.decode(k, force=True)] = v 

3399 self.psubscribe(**patterns) 

3400 

3401 @property 

3402 def subscribed(self): 

3403 "Indicates if there are subscriptions to any channels or patterns" 

3404 return bool(self.channels or self.patterns) 

3405 

3406 def execute_command(self, *args): 

3407 "Execute a publish/subscribe command" 

3408 

3409 # NOTE: don't parse the response in this function -- it could pull a 

3410 # legitimate message off the stack if the connection is already 

3411 # subscribed to one or more channels 

3412 

3413 if self.connection is None: 

3414 self.connection = self.connection_pool.get_connection( 

3415 'pubsub', 

3416 self.shard_hint 

3417 ) 

3418 # register a callback that re-subscribes to any channels we 

3419 # were listening to when we were disconnected 

3420 self.connection.register_connect_callback(self.on_connect) 

3421 connection = self.connection 

3422 kwargs = {'check_health': not self.subscribed} 

3423 self._execute(connection, connection.send_command, *args, **kwargs) 

3424 

3425 def _execute(self, connection, command, *args, **kwargs): 

3426 try: 

3427 return command(*args, **kwargs) 

3428 except (ConnectionError, TimeoutError) as e: 

3429 connection.disconnect() 

3430 if not (connection.retry_on_timeout and 

3431 isinstance(e, TimeoutError)): 

3432 raise 

3433 # Connect manually here. If the Redis server is down, this will 

3434 # fail and raise a ConnectionError as desired. 

3435 connection.connect() 

3436 # the ``on_connect`` callback should haven been called by the 

3437 # connection to resubscribe us to any channels and patterns we were 

3438 # previously listening to 

3439 return command(*args, **kwargs) 

3440 

3441 def parse_response(self, block=True, timeout=0): 

3442 "Parse the response from a publish/subscribe command" 

3443 conn = self.connection 

3444 if conn is None: 

3445 raise RuntimeError( 

3446 'pubsub connection not set: ' 

3447 'did you forget to call subscribe() or psubscribe()?') 

3448 

3449 self.check_health() 

3450 

3451 if not block and not conn.can_read(timeout=timeout): 

3452 return None 

3453 response = self._execute(conn, conn.read_response) 

3454 

3455 if conn.health_check_interval and \ 

3456 response == self.health_check_response: 

3457 # ignore the health check message as user might not expect it 

3458 return None 

3459 return response 

3460 

3461 def check_health(self): 

3462 conn = self.connection 

3463 if conn is None: 

3464 raise RuntimeError( 

3465 'pubsub connection not set: ' 

3466 'did you forget to call subscribe() or psubscribe()?') 

3467 

3468 if conn.health_check_interval and time.time() > conn.next_health_check: 

3469 conn.send_command('PING', self.HEALTH_CHECK_MESSAGE, 

3470 check_health=False) 

3471 

3472 def _normalize_keys(self, data): 

3473 """ 

3474 normalize channel/pattern names to be either bytes or strings 

3475 based on whether responses are automatically decoded. this saves us 

3476 from coercing the value for each message coming in. 

3477 """ 

3478 encode = self.encoder.encode 

3479 decode = self.encoder.decode 

3480 return {decode(encode(k)): v for k, v in iteritems(data)} 

3481 

3482 def psubscribe(self, *args, **kwargs): 

3483 """ 

3484 Subscribe to channel patterns. Patterns supplied as keyword arguments 

3485 expect a pattern name as the key and a callable as the value. A 

3486 pattern's callable will be invoked automatically when a message is 

3487 received on that pattern rather than producing a message via 

3488 ``listen()``. 

3489 """ 

3490 if args: 

3491 args = list_or_args(args[0], args[1:]) 

3492 new_patterns = dict.fromkeys(args) 

3493 new_patterns.update(kwargs) 

3494 ret_val = self.execute_command('PSUBSCRIBE', *iterkeys(new_patterns)) 

3495 # update the patterns dict AFTER we send the command. we don't want to 

3496 # subscribe twice to these patterns, once for the command and again 

3497 # for the reconnection. 

3498 new_patterns = self._normalize_keys(new_patterns) 

3499 self.patterns.update(new_patterns) 

3500 self.pending_unsubscribe_patterns.difference_update(new_patterns) 

3501 return ret_val 

3502 

3503 def punsubscribe(self, *args): 

3504 """ 

3505 Unsubscribe from the supplied patterns. If empty, unsubscribe from 

3506 all patterns. 

3507 """ 

3508 if args: 

3509 args = list_or_args(args[0], args[1:]) 

3510 patterns = self._normalize_keys(dict.fromkeys(args)) 

3511 else: 

3512 patterns = self.patterns 

3513 self.pending_unsubscribe_patterns.update(patterns) 

3514 return self.execute_command('PUNSUBSCRIBE', *args) 

3515 

3516 def subscribe(self, *args, **kwargs): 

3517 """ 

3518 Subscribe to channels. Channels supplied as keyword arguments expect 

3519 a channel name as the key and a callable as the value. A channel's 

3520 callable will be invoked automatically when a message is received on 

3521 that channel rather than producing a message via ``listen()`` or 

3522 ``get_message()``. 

3523 """ 

3524 if args: 

3525 args = list_or_args(args[0], args[1:]) 

3526 new_channels = dict.fromkeys(args) 

3527 new_channels.update(kwargs) 

3528 ret_val = self.execute_command('SUBSCRIBE', *iterkeys(new_channels)) 

3529 # update the channels dict AFTER we send the command. we don't want to 

3530 # subscribe twice to these channels, once for the command and again 

3531 # for the reconnection. 

3532 new_channels = self._normalize_keys(new_channels) 

3533 self.channels.update(new_channels) 

3534 self.pending_unsubscribe_channels.difference_update(new_channels) 

3535 return ret_val 

3536 

3537 def unsubscribe(self, *args): 

3538 """ 

3539 Unsubscribe from the supplied channels. If empty, unsubscribe from 

3540 all channels 

3541 """ 

3542 if args: 

3543 args = list_or_args(args[0], args[1:]) 

3544 channels = self._normalize_keys(dict.fromkeys(args)) 

3545 else: 

3546 channels = self.channels 

3547 self.pending_unsubscribe_channels.update(channels) 

3548 return self.execute_command('UNSUBSCRIBE', *args) 

3549 

3550 def listen(self): 

3551 "Listen for messages on channels this client has been subscribed to" 

3552 while self.subscribed: 

3553 response = self.handle_message(self.parse_response(block=True)) 

3554 if response is not None: 

3555 yield response 

3556 

3557 def get_message(self, ignore_subscribe_messages=False, timeout=0): 

3558 """ 

3559 Get the next message if one is available, otherwise None. 

3560 

3561 If timeout is specified, the system will wait for `timeout` seconds 

3562 before returning. Timeout should be specified as a floating point 

3563 number. 

3564 """ 

3565 response = self.parse_response(block=False, timeout=timeout) 

3566 if response: 

3567 return self.handle_message(response, ignore_subscribe_messages) 

3568 return None 

3569 

3570 def ping(self, message=None): 

3571 """ 

3572 Ping the Redis server 

3573 """ 

3574 message = '' if message is None else message 

3575 return self.execute_command('PING', message) 

3576 

3577 def handle_message(self, response, ignore_subscribe_messages=False): 

3578 """ 

3579 Parses a pub/sub message. If the channel or pattern was subscribed to 

3580 with a message handler, the handler is invoked instead of a parsed 

3581 message being returned. 

3582 """ 

3583 message_type = nativestr(response[0]) 

3584 if message_type == 'pmessage': 

3585 message = { 

3586 'type': message_type, 

3587 'pattern': response[1], 

3588 'channel': response[2], 

3589 'data': response[3] 

3590 } 

3591 elif message_type == 'pong': 

3592 message = { 

3593 'type': message_type, 

3594 'pattern': None, 

3595 'channel': None, 

3596 'data': response[1] 

3597 } 

3598 else: 

3599 message = { 

3600 'type': message_type, 

3601 'pattern': None, 

3602 'channel': response[1], 

3603 'data': response[2] 

3604 } 

3605 

3606 # if this is an unsubscribe message, remove it from memory 

3607 if message_type in self.UNSUBSCRIBE_MESSAGE_TYPES: 

3608 if message_type == 'punsubscribe': 

3609 pattern = response[1] 

3610 if pattern in self.pending_unsubscribe_patterns: 

3611 self.pending_unsubscribe_patterns.remove(pattern) 

3612 self.patterns.pop(pattern, None) 

3613 else: 

3614 channel = response[1] 

3615 if channel in self.pending_unsubscribe_channels: 

3616 self.pending_unsubscribe_channels.remove(channel) 

3617 self.channels.pop(channel, None) 

3618 

3619 if message_type in self.PUBLISH_MESSAGE_TYPES: 

3620 # if there's a message handler, invoke it 

3621 if message_type == 'pmessage': 

3622 handler = self.patterns.get(message['pattern'], None) 

3623 else: 

3624 handler = self.channels.get(message['channel'], None) 

3625 if handler: 

3626 handler(message) 

3627 return None 

3628 elif message_type != 'pong': 

3629 # this is a subscribe/unsubscribe message. ignore if we don't 

3630 # want them 

3631 if ignore_subscribe_messages or self.ignore_subscribe_messages: 

3632 return None 

3633 

3634 return message 

3635 

3636 def run_in_thread(self, sleep_time=0, daemon=False): 

3637 for channel, handler in iteritems(self.channels): 

3638 if handler is None: 

3639 raise PubSubError("Channel: '%s' has no handler registered" % 

3640 channel) 

3641 for pattern, handler in iteritems(self.patterns): 

3642 if handler is None: 

3643 raise PubSubError("Pattern: '%s' has no handler registered" % 

3644 pattern) 

3645 

3646 thread = PubSubWorkerThread(self, sleep_time, daemon=daemon) 

3647 thread.start() 

3648 return thread 

3649 

3650 

3651class PubSubWorkerThread(threading.Thread): 

3652 def __init__(self, pubsub, sleep_time, daemon=False): 

3653 super(PubSubWorkerThread, self).__init__() 

3654 self.daemon = daemon 

3655 self.pubsub = pubsub 

3656 self.sleep_time = sleep_time 

3657 self._running = threading.Event() 

3658 

3659 def run(self): 

3660 if self._running.is_set(): 

3661 return 

3662 self._running.set() 

3663 pubsub = self.pubsub 

3664 sleep_time = self.sleep_time 

3665 while self._running.is_set(): 

3666 pubsub.get_message(ignore_subscribe_messages=True, 

3667 timeout=sleep_time) 

3668 pubsub.close() 

3669 

3670 def stop(self): 

3671 # trip the flag so the run loop exits. the run loop will 

3672 # close the pubsub connection, which disconnects the socket 

3673 # and returns the connection to the pool. 

3674 self._running.clear() 

3675 

3676 

3677class Pipeline(Redis): 

3678 """ 

3679 Pipelines provide a way to transmit multiple commands to the Redis server 

3680 in one transmission. This is convenient for batch processing, such as 

3681 saving all the values in a list to Redis. 

3682 

3683 All commands executed within a pipeline are wrapped with MULTI and EXEC 

3684 calls. This guarantees all commands executed in the pipeline will be 

3685 executed atomically. 

3686 

3687 Any command raising an exception does *not* halt the execution of 

3688 subsequent commands in the pipeline. Instead, the exception is caught 

3689 and its instance is placed into the response list returned by execute(). 

3690 Code iterating over the response list should be able to deal with an 

3691 instance of an exception as a potential value. In general, these will be 

3692 ResponseError exceptions, such as those raised when issuing a command 

3693 on a key of a different datatype. 

3694 """ 

3695 

3696 UNWATCH_COMMANDS = {'DISCARD', 'EXEC', 'UNWATCH'} 

3697 

3698 def __init__(self, connection_pool, response_callbacks, transaction, 

3699 shard_hint): 

3700 self.connection_pool = connection_pool 

3701 self.connection = None 

3702 self.response_callbacks = response_callbacks 

3703 self.transaction = transaction 

3704 self.shard_hint = shard_hint 

3705 

3706 self.watching = False 

3707 self.reset() 

3708 

3709 def __enter__(self): 

3710 return self 

3711 

3712 def __exit__(self, exc_type, exc_value, traceback): 

3713 self.reset() 

3714 

3715 def __del__(self): 

3716 try: 

3717 self.reset() 

3718 except Exception: 

3719 pass 

3720 

3721 def __len__(self): 

3722 return len(self.command_stack) 

3723 

3724 def __nonzero__(self): 

3725 "Pipeline instances should always evaluate to True on Python 2.7" 

3726 return True 

3727 

3728 def __bool__(self): 

3729 "Pipeline instances should always evaluate to True on Python 3+" 

3730 return True 

3731 

3732 def reset(self): 

3733 self.command_stack = [] 

3734 self.scripts = set() 

3735 # make sure to reset the connection state in the event that we were 

3736 # watching something 

3737 if self.watching and self.connection: 

3738 try: 

3739 # call this manually since our unwatch or 

3740 # immediate_execute_command methods can call reset() 

3741 self.connection.send_command('UNWATCH') 

3742 self.connection.read_response() 

3743 except ConnectionError: 

3744 # disconnect will also remove any previous WATCHes 

3745 self.connection.disconnect() 

3746 # clean up the other instance attributes 

3747 self.watching = False 

3748 self.explicit_transaction = False 

3749 # we can safely return the connection to the pool here since we're 

3750 # sure we're no longer WATCHing anything 

3751 if self.connection: 

3752 self.connection_pool.release(self.connection) 

3753 self.connection = None 

3754 

3755 def multi(self): 

3756 """ 

3757 Start a transactional block of the pipeline after WATCH commands 

3758 are issued. End the transactional block with `execute`. 

3759 """ 

3760 if self.explicit_transaction: 

3761 raise RedisError('Cannot issue nested calls to MULTI') 

3762 if self.command_stack: 

3763 raise RedisError('Commands without an initial WATCH have already ' 

3764 'been issued') 

3765 self.explicit_transaction = True 

3766 

3767 def execute_command(self, *args, **kwargs): 

3768 if (self.watching or args[0] == 'WATCH') and \ 

3769 not self.explicit_transaction: 

3770 return self.immediate_execute_command(*args, **kwargs) 

3771 return self.pipeline_execute_command(*args, **kwargs) 

3772 

3773 def immediate_execute_command(self, *args, **options): 

3774 """ 

3775 Execute a command immediately, but don't auto-retry on a 

3776 ConnectionError if we're already WATCHing a variable. Used when 

3777 issuing WATCH or subsequent commands retrieving their values but before 

3778 MULTI is called. 

3779 """ 

3780 command_name = args[0] 

3781 conn = self.connection 

3782 # if this is the first call, we need a connection 

3783 if not conn: 

3784 conn = self.connection_pool.get_connection(command_name, 

3785 self.shard_hint) 

3786 self.connection = conn 

3787 try: 

3788 conn.send_command(*args) 

3789 return self.parse_response(conn, command_name, **options) 

3790 except (ConnectionError, TimeoutError) as e: 

3791 conn.disconnect() 

3792 # if we were already watching a variable, the watch is no longer 

3793 # valid since this connection has died. raise a WatchError, which 

3794 # indicates the user should retry this transaction. 

3795 if self.watching: 

3796 self.reset() 

3797 raise WatchError("A ConnectionError occured on while watching " 

3798 "one or more keys") 

3799 # if retry_on_timeout is not set, or the error is not 

3800 # a TimeoutError, raise it 

3801 if not (conn.retry_on_timeout and isinstance(e, TimeoutError)): 

3802 self.reset() 

3803 raise 

3804 

3805 # retry_on_timeout is set, this is a TimeoutError and we are not 

3806 # already WATCHing any variables. retry the command. 

3807 try: 

3808 conn.send_command(*args) 

3809 return self.parse_response(conn, command_name, **options) 

3810 except (ConnectionError, TimeoutError): 

3811 # a subsequent failure should simply be raised 

3812 self.reset() 

3813 raise 

3814 

3815 def pipeline_execute_command(self, *args, **options): 

3816 """ 

3817 Stage a command to be executed when execute() is next called 

3818 

3819 Returns the current Pipeline object back so commands can be 

3820 chained together, such as: 

3821 

3822 pipe = pipe.set('foo', 'bar').incr('baz').decr('bang') 

3823 

3824 At some other point, you can then run: pipe.execute(), 

3825 which will execute all commands queued in the pipe. 

3826 """ 

3827 self.command_stack.append((args, options)) 

3828 return self 

3829 

3830 def _execute_transaction(self, connection, commands, raise_on_error): 

3831 cmds = chain([(('MULTI', ), {})], commands, [(('EXEC', ), {})]) 

3832 all_cmds = connection.pack_commands([args for args, options in cmds 

3833 if EMPTY_RESPONSE not in options]) 

3834 connection.send_packed_command(all_cmds) 

3835 errors = [] 

3836 

3837 # parse off the response for MULTI 

3838 # NOTE: we need to handle ResponseErrors here and continue 

3839 # so that we read all the additional command messages from 

3840 # the socket 

3841 try: 

3842 self.parse_response(connection, '_') 

3843 except ResponseError: 

3844 errors.append((0, sys.exc_info()[1])) 

3845 

3846 # and all the other commands 

3847 for i, command in enumerate(commands): 

3848 if EMPTY_RESPONSE in command[1]: 

3849 errors.append((i, command[1][EMPTY_RESPONSE])) 

3850 else: 

3851 try: 

3852 self.parse_response(connection, '_') 

3853 except ResponseError: 

3854 ex = sys.exc_info()[1] 

3855 self.annotate_exception(ex, i + 1, command[0]) 

3856 errors.append((i, ex)) 

3857 

3858 # parse the EXEC. 

3859 try: 

3860 response = self.parse_response(connection, '_') 

3861 except ExecAbortError: 

3862 if self.explicit_transaction: 

3863 self.immediate_execute_command('DISCARD') 

3864 if errors: 

3865 raise errors[0][1] 

3866 raise sys.exc_info()[1] 

3867 

3868 if response is None: 

3869 raise WatchError("Watched variable changed.") 

3870 

3871 # put any parse errors into the response 

3872 for i, e in errors: 

3873 response.insert(i, e) 

3874 

3875 if len(response) != len(commands): 

3876 self.connection.disconnect() 

3877 raise ResponseError("Wrong number of response items from " 

3878 "pipeline execution") 

3879 

3880 # find any errors in the response and raise if necessary 

3881 if raise_on_error: 

3882 self.raise_first_error(commands, response) 

3883 

3884 # We have to run response callbacks manually 

3885 data = [] 

3886 for r, cmd in izip(response, commands): 

3887 if not isinstance(r, Exception): 

3888 args, options = cmd 

3889 command_name = args[0] 

3890 if command_name in self.response_callbacks: 

3891 r = self.response_callbacks[command_name](r, **options) 

3892 data.append(r) 

3893 return data 

3894 

3895 def _execute_pipeline(self, connection, commands, raise_on_error): 

3896 # build up all commands into a single request to increase network perf 

3897 all_cmds = connection.pack_commands([args for args, _ in commands]) 

3898 connection.send_packed_command(all_cmds) 

3899 

3900 response = [] 

3901 for args, options in commands: 

3902 try: 

3903 response.append( 

3904 self.parse_response(connection, args[0], **options)) 

3905 except ResponseError: 

3906 response.append(sys.exc_info()[1]) 

3907 

3908 if raise_on_error: 

3909 self.raise_first_error(commands, response) 

3910 return response 

3911 

3912 def raise_first_error(self, commands, response): 

3913 for i, r in enumerate(response): 

3914 if isinstance(r, ResponseError): 

3915 self.annotate_exception(r, i + 1, commands[i][0]) 

3916 raise r 

3917 

3918 def annotate_exception(self, exception, number, command): 

3919 cmd = ' '.join(imap(safe_unicode, command)) 

3920 msg = 'Command # %d (%s) of pipeline caused error: %s' % ( 

3921 number, cmd, safe_unicode(exception.args[0])) 

3922 exception.args = (msg,) + exception.args[1:] 

3923 

3924 def parse_response(self, connection, command_name, **options): 

3925 result = Redis.parse_response( 

3926 self, connection, command_name, **options) 

3927 if command_name in self.UNWATCH_COMMANDS: 

3928 self.watching = False 

3929 elif command_name == 'WATCH': 

3930 self.watching = True 

3931 return result 

3932 

3933 def load_scripts(self): 

3934 # make sure all scripts that are about to be run on this pipeline exist 

3935 scripts = list(self.scripts) 

3936 immediate = self.immediate_execute_command 

3937 shas = [s.sha for s in scripts] 

3938 # we can't use the normal script_* methods because they would just 

3939 # get buffered in the pipeline. 

3940 exists = immediate('SCRIPT EXISTS', *shas) 

3941 if not all(exists): 

3942 for s, exist in izip(scripts, exists): 

3943 if not exist: 

3944 s.sha = immediate('SCRIPT LOAD', s.script) 

3945 

3946 def execute(self, raise_on_error=True): 

3947 "Execute all the commands in the current pipeline" 

3948 stack = self.command_stack 

3949 if not stack and not self.watching: 

3950 return [] 

3951 if self.scripts: 

3952 self.load_scripts() 

3953 if self.transaction or self.explicit_transaction: 

3954 execute = self._execute_transaction 

3955 else: 

3956 execute = self._execute_pipeline 

3957 

3958 conn = self.connection 

3959 if not conn: 

3960 conn = self.connection_pool.get_connection('MULTI', 

3961 self.shard_hint) 

3962 # assign to self.connection so reset() releases the connection 

3963 # back to the pool after we're done 

3964 self.connection = conn 

3965 

3966 try: 

3967 return execute(conn, stack, raise_on_error) 

3968 except (ConnectionError, TimeoutError) as e: 

3969 conn.disconnect() 

3970 # if we were watching a variable, the watch is no longer valid 

3971 # since this connection has died. raise a WatchError, which 

3972 # indicates the user should retry this transaction. 

3973 if self.watching: 

3974 raise WatchError("A ConnectionError occured on while watching " 

3975 "one or more keys") 

3976 # if retry_on_timeout is not set, or the error is not 

3977 # a TimeoutError, raise it 

3978 if not (conn.retry_on_timeout and isinstance(e, TimeoutError)): 

3979 raise 

3980 # retry a TimeoutError when retry_on_timeout is set 

3981 return execute(conn, stack, raise_on_error) 

3982 finally: 

3983 self.reset() 

3984 

3985 def watch(self, *names): 

3986 "Watches the values at keys ``names``" 

3987 if self.explicit_transaction: 

3988 raise RedisError('Cannot issue a WATCH after a MULTI') 

3989 return self.execute_command('WATCH', *names) 

3990 

3991 def unwatch(self): 

3992 "Unwatches all previously specified keys" 

3993 return self.watching and self.execute_command('UNWATCH') or True 

3994 

3995 

3996class Script(object): 

3997 "An executable Lua script object returned by ``register_script``" 

3998 

3999 def __init__(self, registered_client, script): 

4000 self.registered_client = registered_client 

4001 self.script = script 

4002 # Precalculate and store the SHA1 hex digest of the script. 

4003 

4004 if isinstance(script, basestring): 

4005 # We need the encoding from the client in order to generate an 

4006 # accurate byte representation of the script 

4007 encoder = registered_client.connection_pool.get_encoder() 

4008 script = encoder.encode(script) 

4009 self.sha = hashlib.sha1(script).hexdigest() 

4010 

4011 def __call__(self, keys=[], args=[], client=None): 

4012 "Execute the script, passing any required ``args``" 

4013 if client is None: 

4014 client = self.registered_client 

4015 args = tuple(keys) + tuple(args) 

4016 # make sure the Redis server knows about the script 

4017 if isinstance(client, Pipeline): 

4018 # Make sure the pipeline can register the script before executing. 

4019 client.scripts.add(self) 

4020 try: 

4021 return client.evalsha(self.sha, len(keys), *args) 

4022 except NoScriptError: 

4023 # Maybe the client is pointed to a differnet server than the client 

4024 # that created this instance? 

4025 # Overwrite the sha just in case there was a discrepancy. 

4026 self.sha = client.script_load(self.script) 

4027 return client.evalsha(self.sha, len(keys), *args) 

4028 

4029 

4030class BitFieldOperation(object): 

4031 """ 

4032 Command builder for BITFIELD commands. 

4033 """ 

4034 def __init__(self, client, key, default_overflow=None): 

4035 self.client = client 

4036 self.key = key 

4037 self._default_overflow = default_overflow 

4038 self.reset() 

4039 

4040 def reset(self): 

4041 """ 

4042 Reset the state of the instance to when it was constructed 

4043 """ 

4044 self.operations = [] 

4045 self._last_overflow = 'WRAP' 

4046 self.overflow(self._default_overflow or self._last_overflow) 

4047 

4048 def overflow(self, overflow): 

4049 """ 

4050 Update the overflow algorithm of successive INCRBY operations 

4051 :param overflow: Overflow algorithm, one of WRAP, SAT, FAIL. See the 

4052 Redis docs for descriptions of these algorithmsself. 

4053 :returns: a :py:class:`BitFieldOperation` instance. 

4054 """ 

4055 overflow = overflow.upper() 

4056 if overflow != self._last_overflow: 

4057 self._last_overflow = overflow 

4058 self.operations.append(('OVERFLOW', overflow)) 

4059 return self 

4060 

4061 def incrby(self, fmt, offset, increment, overflow=None): 

4062 """ 

4063 Increment a bitfield by a given amount. 

4064 :param fmt: format-string for the bitfield being updated, e.g. 'u8' 

4065 for an unsigned 8-bit integer. 

4066 :param offset: offset (in number of bits). If prefixed with a 

4067 '#', this is an offset multiplier, e.g. given the arguments 

4068 fmt='u8', offset='#2', the offset will be 16. 

4069 :param int increment: value to increment the bitfield by. 

4070 :param str overflow: overflow algorithm. Defaults to WRAP, but other 

4071 acceptable values are SAT and FAIL. See the Redis docs for 

4072 descriptions of these algorithms. 

4073 :returns: a :py:class:`BitFieldOperation` instance. 

4074 """ 

4075 if overflow is not None: 

4076 self.overflow(overflow) 

4077 

4078 self.operations.append(('INCRBY', fmt, offset, increment)) 

4079 return self 

4080 

4081 def get(self, fmt, offset): 

4082 """ 

4083 Get the value of a given bitfield. 

4084 :param fmt: format-string for the bitfield being read, e.g. 'u8' for 

4085 an unsigned 8-bit integer. 

4086 :param offset: offset (in number of bits). If prefixed with a 

4087 '#', this is an offset multiplier, e.g. given the arguments 

4088 fmt='u8', offset='#2', the offset will be 16. 

4089 :returns: a :py:class:`BitFieldOperation` instance. 

4090 """ 

4091 self.operations.append(('GET', fmt, offset)) 

4092 return self 

4093 

4094 def set(self, fmt, offset, value): 

4095 """ 

4096 Set the value of a given bitfield. 

4097 :param fmt: format-string for the bitfield being read, e.g. 'u8' for 

4098 an unsigned 8-bit integer. 

4099 :param offset: offset (in number of bits). If prefixed with a 

4100 '#', this is an offset multiplier, e.g. given the arguments 

4101 fmt='u8', offset='#2', the offset will be 16. 

4102 :param int value: value to set at the given position. 

4103 :returns: a :py:class:`BitFieldOperation` instance. 

4104 """ 

4105 self.operations.append(('SET', fmt, offset, value)) 

4106 return self 

4107 

4108 @property 

4109 def command(self): 

4110 cmd = ['BITFIELD', self.key] 

4111 for ops in self.operations: 

4112 cmd.extend(ops) 

4113 return cmd 

4114 

4115 def execute(self): 

4116 """ 

4117 Execute the operation(s) in a single BITFIELD command. The return value 

4118 is a list of values corresponding to each operation. If the client 

4119 used to create this instance was a pipeline, the list of values 

4120 will be present within the pipeline's execute. 

4121 """ 

4122 command = self.command 

4123 self.reset() 

4124 return self.client.execute_command(*command)
